deepl-formality-select.name: Style

explanation.add-moderators:
## Moderators 

Guest and permanent moderators have the same rights as the creator of the room. But they can't delete questions or the whole room. 

Everyone can be added as a **permanent moderator** with their **mail address** with which they registered at »frag.jetzt«. 

An unregistered user can become a **guest moderator** by entering the room via **direct link** or 8-digit **access code**.
explanation.bonus-archive:
## Bonus Archive 

All questions that you have marked with a star in your rooms are listed here. You can use the list to check whether the bonus code that a participant sent you by mail is valid. 

To find a code quickly, there is a search field. If the code is valid, you can display the corresponding question directly via a link.
explanation.brainstorming:
## Brainstorming 

When creating a brainstorming session, moderators set the topic of the session and the maximum number of words and characters per contribution. If only one word is allowed as a contribution, an AI performs a morphological comparison of all contributions. Multiple entries are reliably detected despite different inflection and spelling of the words and displayed in an appropriate font size in a word cloud. 

Each entry in the word cloud can be voted on. To do this, move the mouse pointer over the entry and click on a voting icon in the associated pop-up window.
explanation.cloud-configuration:
## AI settings 

Here you can find an overview of all keywords and the blacklist of entries that you have banned from the word cloud. You can also customize the keyword extraction AI and configure the size and density of the word cloud.

First, you define the origin of the keywords: whether the user's keywords and/or the keywords from the automatic extraction are taken as input for the word cloud.

After defining the origin of the data, you can set the weighting of the metadata, which ultimately determines the size and centrality of a keyword.

The blacklist and profanity filter are a good way to remove keywords from the word cloud manually and, in some cases, automatically.

With some language expertise, you can grammatically restrict or extend the generation of the word cloud. For example, you can specify that only nouns that act as the grammatical subject of a sentence are displayed. The grammatical settings are language-specific.

The last setting concerns the display threshold for keywords in the word cloud. When a lot of questions and answers are analyzed, it is easy to lose track. If you increase the display threshold for keywords (minimum number of questions, questioners and up-votes with this keyword) or limit the time period in which the questions were asked or answered, then the size and density of the word cloud is also reduced. This way you can experimentally optimize the significance of the keywords. Have fun!
explanation.deepl:
## Text optimization

To make your question as readable and understandable as possible, we have it translated into German and back into English using the translation program [DeepL](https://www.deepl.com/translator).

The back translation is in almost all cases better than the original in terms of spelling, grammar, punctuation and language style. Back translation can be done in two ways: informally or formally.
explanation.label: Explain
explanation.room-settings-overview:
## Room settings 

Here you can see all settings of the room at a glance. 

You can also make changes later in the options menu of the room. 

Because of the anonymity of the users and the potential abuse of the Q&A forum, we offer you restriction options with the first three buttons. Look at the hints in the tooltips of the buttons.
explanation.spacy:
## Text analysis

Using NLP (Natural Language Processing) your question will be analyzed grammatically. The recognized nouns are put into their basic form, i.e. lemmatized, and suggested to you as keywords. For the text analysis we use the free NLP software [spaCy](https://spacy.io/). 

The keywords can be used to filter the list of questions or to create a word cloud.
explanation.topic-cloud:
## Question radar 

 If you want to keep track of all questions, you need a kind of "radar". Our radar locates questions and answers by their keywords: The more questions and answers refer to a keyword, the larger and more central the keyword appears on the radar.

 The question radar serves you as a **navigator**: Clicking on a word will take you to the questions and answers related to that keyword. 

 The keywords are determined in real time by means of a grammatical analysis of the nouns or were determined by the author. 
 The calculation of the font size includes:

* the difference between up- and down-votes, if positive,
* the number of questions with this keyword,
* the number of question creators with this keyword,
* the role: room creator, moderator, or participant,
* whether a question category was selected,
* whether the keyword was generated or assigned,
* whether the question was answered,
* the controversiality of the question. 

You can customize the visualization to your liking.  In the role of room creator or moderator, you can experiment with the parameters of the keyword generation to improve the **semantic selectivity**.
explanation.user-bonus:
## Bonus 

The teacher can mark »good« questions for a bonus. Your questions from all courses (rooms) that have received a star will be listed here.

Depending on the agreement, you can email the code of the star to the teacher to redeem it for a bonus.

gpt-chat.temperature-tooltip-creative: This setting allows for a larger margin and thus more creative responses.
gpt-chat.temperature-tooltip-balanced: Balanced answers can change, but are often very well matched to the question.
gpt-chat.temperature-tooltip-precise: Allows virtually no leeway. The answers are almost identical and thus partially deterministic.
gpt-chat.privacy-policy: Privacy Policy for the Use of OpenAI API
gpt-chat.selection-none: If no selection is made, ChatGPT may have a larger response area. This may result in unwanted information being generated.
gpt-chat.tooltip-temperature-disabled: Response variability is taken from selected prompt.

response-format.hover: A brief and concise answer that provides information quickly and easily.
Explanation of the meaning of terms and concepts to promote understanding.
Application of abstract concepts to concrete situations to deepen understanding.
Instrument for knowledge transfer and repetition of facts, definitions, terms, or data.
Visual representation of information to illustrate connections between different concepts and ideas.
Detailed answer to open questions to improve skills in writing longer texts.
Short and concise overview of a specific topic or concept.
Quiz questions in which the learner must choose the correct answer from a list of options to check knowledge and understand connections.
References to further information to encourage learners to conduct their own research.

response-format.text: Answer with links to further information
response-format.hover: Links and resources that give learners access to additional materials such as videos, graphics, or articles to deepen understanding.

ml-gpt-room-settings.title: GPT Settings
ml-gpt-room-settings.gpt-setup-step-help:
# ChatGPT as a universal assistant
You can set up ChatGPT on frag.jetzt in two ways:
1. Using an API key that you can request from OpenAI.
2. Using a voucher that you can request from frag.jetzt.

The option with the API key is the more flexible variant, as you can also use the API key for other projects. The voucher option is the more elaborate variant, as you must be a lecturer and complete an evaluation study with your participants. You can also use the voucher option if you do not have an API key.
ml-gpt-room-settings.gpt-info-step-help:
# Api-Key at frag.jetzt
For using ChatGPT via the OpenAI API, you need an API key and optionally an organization.
ml-gpt-room-settings.gpt-info-item-two-error-label-pattern: This is not a valid API key.
ml-gpt-room-settings.gpt-info-item-three-error-label-pattern: This is not a valid organization.
ml-gpt-room-settings.gpt-info-voucher-step-help:
# Voucher at frag.jetzt
If you have requested a voucher at frag.jetzt, you can enter it here. A voucher can only be redeemed once for a user.
ml-gpt-room-settings.gpt-model-step-help:
# LLM within frag.jetzt
OpenAI offers various models that differ in their performance and costs. The choice of model affects the quality of the answers and the costs.
ml-gpt-room-settings.room-quota-step-help:
# Individual settings for the room
Here you can set the quotas for the room. The quotas apply to all users in the room.
ml-gpt-room-settings.moderator-quota-step-help:
# Individual settings for the moderator
Here you can set the quotas for the moderator. The quotas apply to all moderators in the room.
ml-gpt-room-settings.participant-quota-step-help:
# Individual settings for the participant
Here you can set the quotas for the participant. The quotas apply to all participants in the room.
ml-gpt-room-settings.usage-time-step-help:
# The periods in which ChatGPT can be used
Here you can set the periods in which ChatGPT can be used.
ml-gpt-room-settings.usage-time-item-one-select-error-label-t: The start time must be before the end time.
ml-gpt-room-settings.miscellaneous-settings-step-help:
# Further settings for ChatGPT
Here you can make further settings for ChatGPT.
ml-gpt-room-settings.miscellaneous-settings-item-two-label: Let ChatGPT respond without prompt suggestions
ml-gpt-room-settings.miscellaneous-settings-item-three-label: Let ChatGPT respond only upon request
ml-gpt-room-settings.moderator-permissions-step-help:
# Permissions for moderators
Here you can set the permissions for moderators. The permissions apply to all moderators in the room.

gpt-room-settings.title: ChatGPT Settings
gpt-room-settings.trial-info: I am participating in the free evaluation study of THM »ChatGPT in Education«:
gpt-room-settings.global-trial: The frag.jetzt team has given you $ {{max}} for a three-month trial period. That's enough for a few million words in conversations using the GPT-3.5 turbo language model. So far you have used $ {{counter}}.
gpt-room-settings.trial-code: I have received the following activation code from the frag.jetzt team:
gpt-room-settings.trial-enabled: Perfect: You are participating in the evaluation study.
gpt-room-settings.trial-activated-info: Through the evaluation study you have {{quota}}$ per month. This month {{counter}}$ have already been used.
gpt-room-settings.rest-contingent-description: The quota management is there to control the budget for the use of ChatGPT in the current room. This way you can set how many requests moderators or participants can make per day, month or in total, ensuring that requests to ChatGPT are possible for the entire period and are not used up on the first day.
gpt-room-settings.rest-flow-description: The fluid quota works differently than other quotas. Every day, a part of the quota is released. For example, with a $20 quota, $20 * 2 / 31, or about $1.29, will be available on January 2.
gpt-room-settings.own-openai-api-key: Use ChatGPT with your API key from OpenAI:
gpt-room-settings.own-openai-info: If the evaluation study is active, billing will still be done through your own OpenAI account. All amounts in US dollars.

gpt-room-settings.restrictions-moderator: Moderator quota (all amounts in US dollars):
gpt-room-settings.restrictions-participant: Participant quota (all amounts in US dollars):

gpt-room-settings.usage-time-info: If no usage period is created, the API is always accessible.

topic-cloud-dialog.full-text: From the full text of the questions
topic-cloud-dialog.keyword: From the keywords of the question creators
topic-cloud-dialog.keyword-scoring-answerCount-info: Forms a score depending on the number of answers written by a moderator or a creator.
topic-cloud-dialog.keyword-scoring-cappedSummedVotes-info: (See the sum of all votes). The sum cannot fall below zero and becomes a minimum of 0
topic-cloud-dialog.keyword-scoring-controversy-info: Forms a score depending on the up votes and down votes.
topic-cloud-dialog.keyword-scoring-countComments-info: Number of questions from which the keywords have been extracted
topic-cloud-dialog.keyword-scoring-countKeywordByCreator-in: Number of times this keyword has been used by the creator
topic-cloud-dialog.keyword-scoring-countKeywordByModerator-: Number of times this keyword has been used by moderators
topic-cloud-dialog.keyword-scoring-countSelectedByQuestione: Number of times a keyword has been verified by a questioner
topic-cloud-dialog.keyword-scoring-countUsers-info: Number of questioners who used this keyword
topic-cloud-dialog.keyword-scoring-header-info: Adjustable multipliers for the weighting of keywords
topic-cloud-dialog.keyword-scoring-responseCount-info: Forms a score depending on the number of responses written by participants.
topic-cloud-dialog.keyword-scoring-summedDownvotes-info: Number of all down votes made on the questions with this keyword
topic-cloud-dialog.keyword-scoring-summedUpvotes-info: Number of all up votes made on the questions with this keyword
topic-cloud-dialog.keyword-scoring-summedVotes-info: Sum of the up votes and down votes made on the questions with this keyword
topic-cloud-dialog.only-specific-language-will-be-filtered: Only the language of the question will be filtered
topic-cloud-dialog.partial-words-will-be-filtered: Profane partial words will be also filtered
topic-cloud-dialog.select-choice: How should the keywords be determined?
topic-cloud-dialog.spacy-labels: Which nouns of the text analysis should be displayed as topics?
topic-cloud-dialog.words-will-be-overwritten: Profane words will be overwritten with ★★★★.

worker-config.heading: Extract keywords
worker-config.label: Choose from which questions to extract keywords:
worker-config.normal: Reanalyze all questions in the room (Blacklist will be deleted)
worker-config.only-failed: Only questions that have not been analyzed

write-comment.a11y-questioner-name: Here you can enter your name if you want. This is visible for everyone at this comment.
write-comment.name-length-error: The name must be {{min}} to {{max}} characters long.

presets-dialog.role-instruction-placeholder: Describe here role instructions for ChatGPT …

gptchat-info.title: ChatGPT
gptchat-info.blocked-description: Your access to ChatGPT has been blocked due to policy violations. Please contact our support team for more information and assistance.
gptchat-info.noGlobalQuotaAvailable-description: Access to ChatGPT is currently unavailable due to the global token limit being reached. We recommend trying again later.
gptchat-info.NoApiKey-description: A valid OpenAI API key is required to access ChatGPT. Please visit the OpenAI website to generate an API key, and enter it in the room creation dialog.
gptchat-info.roomDisabled-description: Access to this ChatGPT room has been temporarily disabled as the token limit for the room has been reached. We recommend trying again later.
gptchat-info.moderatorDisabled-description: Moderator access to ChatGPT has been temporarily suspended as the token limit for moderators in this room has been reached. Please try again later.
gptchat-info.participantDisabled-description: Participant access to ChatGPT in this room has been temporarily disabled due to reaching the token limit. We recommend trying again later.
gptchat-info.usageTimeOver-description: The permitted usage duration for ChatGPT in this room has been exceeded. Please try again later.

chatgpt-brainstorm.title: Brainstorming over ChatGPT
chatgpt-brainstorm.count-placeholder: Enter the number of ideas here
chatgpt-brainstorm.generate-tooltip: Generates the ideas with the help of ChatGPT
chatgpt-brainstorm.prompt-preset: You are an assistant brought in to help with brainstorming. Always give {{count}} ideas to the following topics. Make sure you format everything with lists in Markdown. An idea should consist of no more than {{wordCount}} words. Try to be under {{charCount}} characters per idea.
chatgpt-brainstorm.prompt: The topic of the brainstorming session is: """{{topic}}"""
